medical_history.chief_complaint: New onset jaundice and dark urine.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms began 2 days prior to presentation. The family noted the patient to be grossly jaundiced and noticed abnormally dark urine. Jaundice has reportedly improved on the day of evaluation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Traumatic brain injury (TBI) secondary to fall from tree, communicating hydrocephalus s/p VP shunt, intermittent urinary incontinence, right-eye blindness. Past surgical history includes tracheostomy and PEG tube, both removed, VP shunt placement and revision.
